moves.1. Nf3: White trys a different opening playing Kf3.
moves.1... d5: good counter by black opening with d5.
moves.2. d3: white to d3, leaving way for development of his dsb or moving a knight in front of his queen.
moves.2... Nf6: black brings out a pesky knight to f6.
moves.3. Nc3: white matches this by bring out his other knight to c3.
moves.3... Bf5: black comes out with his lsb to f5.
moves.4. h3: white is setting up pawn protection for advancing his adjacent pawn to g4. This will have an effect of weakness on king-side castling.
moves.5. g4: g4 is played to attack lsb on f5.
moves.5... d4: black moves up pawn more on d-file to d4 attacking whites knight.
moves.6. Nb5: white has to move knight due to the attacjing pawn.
moves.6... Bg6: black move lsb back from the pawn attack.
moves.8. Nxc6: White knight takes black knight on c6.
moves.8... bxc6: Black pawn takes knight on c6
moves.9. g5: white move pawn to g5 to shew away the pesky knight.
moves.15... f5: Black advances pawn up 2 spaces to pressure whites queen.
gxf6 e.p. I was hoping Black would allow me to take this move. En passant (from French: in passing)
moves.17... Qg7: Black queen put between her king and the checking white queen!
moves.18. Qh5: White queen moves back 1 space to h5
moves.19. Bh6: White DSB to h6 and  attacks Black queen.
moves.19... Qf7: Black queen backs up 1 space to f7 and looking at white queen on h5.
moves.20. Rg1+: white rook to g1 to place black in check!
moves.21. Qh4: white queen moves back to h4  from Black queens attack.
moves.21... Nxb2: Black knight seems lost, not realizing checkmate is soon and white is going to win! Neverless N takes pawn on b2.
moves.22. Bxf8+: indirect check white moves DSB to f8 Check from queen on h4!
moves.22... Qh5: Blacks only move is Queen to block the check.
moves.23. Qxh5#: Checkmate! Q xh5# White never had to castle in this game! Black was up +15 This  game does support the notion that castling is not always the best thing you should do in a chess game. In this game the rook is on g1 on a open g-file.
